column4: Has anyone managed a 11.04 Wubi install on Raid, if so do you know where the tutorial can be found?
..dunno why anyone would put a wubi install on windows on raid , whynot just give ubuntu it's own partition ?
I am simply just attempting a side by side install, I am trying to avoid messing with the raid itself.
Blueskaj, besides partitioning a Raid sounds like a pain...
wubi isn't the way to do a sisde by side install , Demon002
wubi installs ubuntu inside windows , Demon002
Blueskaj, Says Install Ubuntu from Windows.. Sounds like what I am looking for...
I see what you're saying I am not being as literal as I should be.. I know it is installed inside Windows...
ok, then raid in this case is immaterial, Demon002
No it isn't...
just trust me, ubuntu doesn't recognise that Windows is in the same Raid disk and wants to write over the entire 1Tb array.
ok Demon002 , then you're not using wubi
When I reboot into Ubuntu it doesn't allow for correct installation, it flounders... Yeah I am...
I installed Wubi in windows, it asks for a reboot, I do so and boot into Ubuntu.. and then I get floudered with errors and am told it was unable to install
it doesn't matter , I wouldn't know how to help you anyway ...maybe someone else can , but what you're doing is rather convoluted. You'd be better to try a virtual install
!VB
!VM | Demon002
I have it installed on a vm already...
ok Demon002 , nevermind ... I guess what you're doing is beyond my help :)
I appreciate the offer though =)
Anyone have a tutorial for Win7 | Wubi 11.04 install on a RAID 0?
aas I have 2 drives and decided to try it for giggles.
if you already have ubuntu in VM . why wubi ?
